name: customer-delight-central
description:
You're in the Customer Delight area - a large, open-plan office space.
From where you're standing, the most dominant feature in the room is a floor-to-ceiling glass wall decorated with LED lights.

inventory.name: wall
inventory.description: glass wall full of LED lights
inventory.detailedDescription: The lights are green! The product builds are all in great shape and tests are passing. What joy!

inventory.name: chris george
inventory.detailedDescription:
Chris is our resident head of Test.
He's becoming pretty famous in the testing world and has even had people ask for his autograph.

missions.name: partytime
missions.description: Mark wants to organise a celebration

dialogue:
'Hi $player. That's quite a first day you've had so far!'
'I think it's time to celebrate. When you're ready, come and talk to me again and we'll get something organised.'

dialogue.response:
'Right, let's get this party sorted!'
'I've ordered a bus. Give me one last shout when you're ready to round everyone up!'
'OK. Give me a shout when you are.'

locations.name: bus
locations.description: You're on the party bus! Check in with Mark Wightman if you've not done so already and then round everyone up here.

missions.name: partybus
missions.displayName: get everyone on the party bus
missions.description: You did a great job of saving the company. Time for a break. Get everyone onto the party bus before it leaves!

dialogue:
'Hi $player.'
'That was quite a job with the zombies, thanks!'
'I think it's time we all had a break.'
'There's a bus waiting outside to take everyone off to unwind after the day we've had.'
'Can you ask as many people as possible to go to the bus as soon as they can and then wait for the rest there?'
'Once we have a dozen or so partygoers (including yourself), it'll be time to relax.'
'Hey $player, I hope the people organising is going well. Keep up the great work.'

reward.message:
Congratulations. You're doing great at getting the bus loaded. It's hard work herding people around here.

You step out to check for stragglers but as you look back you see a lick of flame through the bus windows. Something's wrong here.

As precious seconds pass you register what's happening and dive for cover.
As the bus explodes into flames before your eyes you realise you've just lured some of your colleagues to their doom.

modifyLocation.name: office-front
modifyLocation.description: You're standing outside the front of the Red Gate offices. The weather has turned grey, damp and miserable. A smell of smoke lingers in the air and the wreckage outside the office seems to be piling up. You can't shake the feeling something is deeply wrong here.

inventory.name: smoke
inventory.detailedDescription: You can't see much although a hint of ash floats by in the breeze.

attributes.smell: It's going to linger in your nose and memories for quite some time.

fail.message:
Oh no! The party bus is leaving and you haven't got enough people on board!
Well that's your crowning glory failed.

You rush to the front of the office to try and salvage your efforts.
As the bus pulls away you see a lick of flame through the windows. Something's wrong here.

You watch in horror before finally registering what's happening and dive for cover.
As the bus explodes into flames you realise it could have been so much worse.

inventory.detailedDescription: Jeff is our head of Software Engineering.

inventory.name: simon cromarty
inventory.detailedDescription: He's our head of Project Management (or a pirate if you give him enough rum).

missions.name: rumforthecaptain
missions.description: Simon's team have just shipped a major release. He wants Rum to celebrate

dialogue:
'Hey $player.'
'I need a cheeky favour from you, if you're willing.'
'My team are just about to ship a new release but I forgot to stock up on the usual celebration supplies.'
'Most teams celebrate with champagne but we have a tradition of celebrating with something a bit tastier.'
'Could you track me down a decent bottle of rum from somewhere?'
'And don't worry, I'll pay you for it.'

dialogue.response: 'Great! I'll be wandering around the office. Come and find me when you've got some.'
'Well if you manage to get hold of any, I'll make it worthwhile.'
'If you find any around, give me a shout. I'd really appreciate it.'
'Hey $player. Did you get hold of any decent rum?'
'You'd be doing the rest of the team a favour too if you could get some.'

'Hang on, this isn't the decent stuff.'
'Try again sunshine.'

reward.message:
Simon opens the bottle and takes a large swig.
'Thankshh $player.' he says, 'It'ssh perfeck!'
He slaps a handful of money into your palm and staggers back towards his team area.
It's funny how many companies have a 'no drinking on site' policy. I think they'd struggle here given the number of release celebrations that seem to happen.
Let's hope there's enough rum left for the team by the time he gets back!
